Description: One of three pieces of an oval scraper, found separately and now rejoined: the scraper was made from a thick flake of dark brown flint, flaked all over one side and retouched along the edges. During manufacture, a large flake separated itself from the butt, carrying with it part of the sharpened edge, and a smaller flake became detached from the worked surface of the implement. The reconstituted scraper has a large bulb of percussion at the butt.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Prof Walter B Emery
Curator's comments: Attached to 1971,0277.59 & 1971,0277.46. A list of the types of flint implements found in tomb 3505 is given in W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' III (London, 1958), 14-15, but it is so abbreviated as to be of little use.
